intro: Ruellia malaca, commonly known as the Malacan ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, tubular flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and disturbed habitats. Ruellia malaca is valued in horticulture for its ornamental flowers and ability to bloom throughout the year.
